Authors: Gui A., Fernando Y., Shaharudin M.S., Mokhtar M., Karmawan I.G.M., Suryanto
Title: Cloud computing adoption using toe framework for Indonesia’s micro small medium enterprises
Affiliations: Information Systems Study Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang26000, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Gui, A., Information Systems Study Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, Y., Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang26000, Malaysia; Shaharudin, M.S., Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang26000, Malaysia; Mokhtar, M., Faculty of Industrial Management, University Malaysia Pahang26000, Malaysia; Karmawan, I.G.M., Information Systems Study Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suryanto, Information Systems Study Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Cloud computing is one of the pillars of the Industrial Revolution 4.0. Cloud computing provides ample benefits to companies such as mobility, ease of access, and enable collaboration. Nevertheless, the impact of cloud computing on the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) is not well established. This research aims to classify the factors affecting the acceptance of cloud computing in Indonesian MSMEs. A total of 135 participants participated in this analysis. The TOE Structure is used in this analysis. Methods of data collection using Google form. The details have been analysed with SPSS and SmartPLS. The findings demonstrated that top management encouragement and relative advantages have a positive impact on the adoption of cloud computing in MSMEs in Indonesia. In order to increase the adoption of cloud-based computing in Indonesia, cloud-based businesses need to concentrate on these two reasons so that MSMEs in Indonesia can embrace more cloud computing. Furthermore, the improvement of cloud computing adoption should come from government policy and incentives. Theoretically, this research helps to establish the TOE framework by providing empirical evidence. This research also explains that the TOE framework can help companies to understand critical domains that impact their businesses and which domain companies should focus. © 2020, Politeknik Negeri Padang. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Cloud computing adoption; Industry revolution 4.0; MSMEs in Indonesia; Relative advantages; Top management support

Title: Analysis of the Influence of Consumer Behavior Using FinTech Services with SEM and TOPSIS
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fernando, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suryanto, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Surjandy, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meyliana, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study will conduct a study of FinTech services regarding influencing factors and see the level of influential factors. The Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) theory from Davis is a theoretical basis and associated with perceived risk factors and trust. The research method used the quantitative method. Analysis data with Structural Equation Model (SEM) using smart pls v2.0. The Technique for Order of Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution (TOPSIS) method to see the level of influence of the variables. We use questionnaires with google form and shared online and the snowball technique for collected data. The survey process obtained 564 respondents who stated to suitable the research criteria. The results are getting the main and very significant factor is the perceived usefulness factor, and the additional factor is trust and perceived ease of use factor. From these factors significantly affect users in adopting FinTech services. With these results, it can describe what factors can be of concern for the development carried out by the company. With these factors, it recognized that risk is a factor that is not considered to consider if the factors of usability and convenience factors that have been given. It also automatically increases the trust of users. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: FinTech; Perceived risk; SEM; TAM Trust; TOPSIS
Index Keywords: Information management; Scanning electron microscopy; Surveys; FinTech; Perceived ease of use; Perceived risk; Perceived usefulness; Structural equation modeling; TAM Trust; Technology acceptance model; TOPSIS; Consumer behavior

Authors: Bazel M.A., Haron H., Ismail I., Suryanto, Gui A.
Title: Factors Influencing Intention to Use Cloud Storage Services Amongst Postgraduate Students in Malaysian Technical Universities
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Faculty of Industrial Management, Universiti Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, Malaysia; Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Bazel, M.A., Faculty of Industrial Management, Universiti Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, Malaysia; Haron, H., Faculty of Industrial Management, Universiti Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, Malaysia; Ismail, I., Faculty of Industrial Management, Universiti Malaysia Pahang, Pahang, Malaysia; Suryanto, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gui, A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to supply empirical evidence about the acceptance of Cloud Storage Services (CSS), by attempting to build an enhanced research framework with based on the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) to identify factors that affect postgraduate students' intentions to use CSS. Factors examined are cloud storage service support, cloud storage self-efficacy, perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use on intention to use CSS. Using convenience sampling method, a total of 219 postgraduate students from 4 Malaysian technical universities participated in the study. Structured equation modelling was used to analyse the data and findings indicate that CSS support have a significant positive relationship with 'perceived usefulness', and 'cloud storage self-efficacy' have significant positive relationship on the 'perceived ease of use'. Both 'perceived usefulness' and 'perceived ease of use' have a significant relationship on students' intention to use CSS. The findings of this study can help the service providers to develop successful strategic plans for usage of CSS. Universities should also have policy and guidelines in using services to ensure the security when access information from intranet. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cloud storage service; ease of use; intention to use; perceived usefulness; self-efficacy; support
Index Keywords: Information management; Students; Supports; Cloud storage services; Ease-of-use; Intention to use; Perceived usefulness; Self efficacy; Digital storage

Title: Bank vs telecommunication E-Wallet : System analysis, purchase, and payment method of GO-mobile CIMB Niaga and T-Cash Telkomsel
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ernawaty, Accounting Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suryanto, Accounting Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Current developing technology in finance is e-wallet. E-wallet is a program or service which allows its user to save digital money and doing transactions easily whenever and wherever. Many banks and nonbank companies are competing to create innovation in this field. Go Mobile is an e-wallet product of CIMB Niaga, meanwhile, T-Cash is an e-wallet issued by a telecommunication company, PT Telkomsel. This research aimed to analyze the system, purchase and payment methods in Go Mobile and T-Cash. This research was done in qualitative design, used secondary data sourced from official websites of both companies as well as related researches. The result showed that Go Mobile and T-Cash's systems could ease the user's transaction. Go Mobile and T-Cash could be used in purchase and payment transaction through SMS as well as Android-based Smartphone application. In T-Cash, users who do not own an Android Smartphone could enjoy this service by attaching Near Field Communication (NFC) sticker on their phone. This is called T-Cash Tap. Based on the usage and ease of use, T-Cash as a telecommunication e-wallet had received highest acceptance in a society based on Technology Acceptance Model (TAM). © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Information management; Near field communication; Purchasing; Sales; Smartphones; Telecommunication; Android smartphone; bank; payment; Payment transactions; Smart-phone applications; Technology acceptance model; Telecommunication companies; The near field communication (NFC); Electronic money

Title: Development of mobile school parent desk using 7C framework
Authors with affiliations: Ongowarsito, H., Binus University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Budiastuti, D., Binus University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Suryanto, Binus University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Customers are very important for the success of an educational institution or company. An educational institution must establish a good relationship with the prospective customer and existing customers in order to maintain and grow customer loyalty. The purpose of this research is to identify the features of an Mobile Parent Desk application needed by parents and school, designing Mobile Parent Desk application according to the needs of parents and the school, implementation plan of a Mobile Parent Desk application. Respondents in this study consisted of two groups: parents and school. The methods of analysis used in the research are factor analysis, 7C framework, and descriptive statistics. The final result of this research is an e-CRM application-Mobile Parent Desk with features developed from 7C framework. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: 7C framework; e-CRM; Factor analysis; Mobile parent desk

Authors: Sabrina C., Gui A., Hendarti H., Suryanto
Title: Feasibility study for investment fixed asset information system (case study at panasonic manufacturing Indonesia)
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sabrina, C., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gui, A., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendarti, H., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suryanto, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The specific objective of this study was to conduct a feasibility study of information technology investment management of fixed assets. Collecting data using interview, documentation study and, questionnaire. To analysis using fit gap analysis, cost benefit analysis and information technology balance score card. The results shows very high gap in operational aspect, positive NPV and payback period on target management in financial aspect, and most users not satisfied with the current system in intangible aspect. Conclusion of this study is that there is a gap in the system of fixed assets that are still running that required significant changes to the system. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: CBA; Fit gap analysis; Information technology investment; ITBSC

Authors: Gui A., Haron H., Suryanto, Sumarwan
Title: Virtualization technology investment feasibility study (case study at regional development bank in Indonesia)
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Graduate School of Business, Universiti Sains MalaysiaPenang  11800, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Gui, A., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Haron, H., Graduate School of Business, Universiti Sains MalaysiaPenang  11800, Malaysia; Suryanto, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sumarwan, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this feasibility study is to provide recommendations to management to make decisions related to investment virtualization technology on one of the regional development banks in Indonesia as an alternative solution to replace the infrastructure that currently exists and is obsolete, with the hope to improve the performance of the company. Method of data collection is through survey, interviews and viewing documentation. Analysis method is using the Fit/Gap Analysis and discounted cash flow to compute net present value. The results of this study indicate only 22.2% of the current system has fit, 55.6% of the current system has partial fit, and 22.2% of the current system has gap, and has positive value of net present value. The conclusion was that companies need to invest in virtualization technologies, by replacing obsolete systems in order to address the gaps and partial so as to improve efficiency and effectiveness. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Discounted cash flow; Fit gap analysis; Net present value; Virtualization technology

Authors: Suryanto, Ricardo I., Gui A., Sabrina C., Maryani
Title: Hospitality management information system investment (feasibility study at PT ABC)
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suryanto, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ricardo, I., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gui, A., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sabrina, C., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maryani, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The Company’s information systems are expected to support the company’s business processes that provide competitive advantage in a competitive business. Before investing information system it is necessary to conduct a feasibility study on running information systems in order to obtain an overview of the support that can be provided by the old system. The method of this study was performed by conducting surveys and interviews for data collection and analysis methods with fit gap analysis, cost benefit analysis and information technology balanced scorecard. The results of this study by using a fit gap analysis showed that only 10% of the system running with fit criteria, so it is necessary to change the system. Proposed new system will provide a 3.9 year payback period of 5 years management estimates. Average achievement by using information technology balanced scorecard is 93.5%. The conclusion that can be drawn from this study is the firm should invest in hospitality management information system by looking at the aspects of operational and financial aspects. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Cost benefit analysis; Feasibility study; Fit gap analysis; IT balanced scorecard

Authors: Gui A., Sabrina C., Suryanto, Kristian V., Margareta V., Hadiwidjaja N.
Title: Monitoring information system quality: Between reality and user expectation at Bina Nusantara University
Affiliations: Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gui, A., Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sabrina, C., Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suryanto, Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kristian, V., Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Margareta, V., Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hadiwidjaja, N., Computerized Accounting Department, Computer Science Faculty, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this research is to determine the user's satisfaction towards Monitoring Information System Quality and to see user's satisfaction level from two dimension, system quality and information quality. Research methods used are data collection method using questionnaire, data processing method using statistical tools such as pearson product moment correlation coefficient and cronbach's alpha, and data analysis method using gap analysis and Cartesians diagram. The expected result is user's expectation is greater than user's real experience; therefore, system quality and information quality have to be improved. Result shows that user is dissatisfied with applied monitoring information system right now. © 2012 Springer Science+Business Media B.V.
